text: So I recently mentioned Dart/Flutter in a curious/positive light. After speaking with people who make android applications I was told just use Kotlin it's the industry standard. Also Flutter has a lot of that bleeding edge feel with it's ecosystem/documentation. I was hoping it was more of a "look we know you have to do this we tried to make it easy and stable as possible". Wasn't my experience - although super brief. Oh well

text: Ubuntu is buying into Flutter, but if its Dart only, I really don't think this will take off. Developers will more likely change their UI kit instead of their main language.

text: I am just not seeing what it offers at this point in time. If it isn't a plug and play way to use Android, etc, then it seems like there already are a number of technologies offering what it does? It's also a smaller community than those technologies... It can deploy to iOS but so can anything in Android studio?
